lines.text: If you were 30 years younger, I'd pull out every hair in your head.
When I was 30 years younger, my wife beat'cha to it!
I certainly hope I run into you again sometime.
Thanks!
At 60 miles an hour!
[Walk up to the jailbird wagon]
Climb in.
You mean ride in that!
Sure!
I won't do it!
Then you'll have to run along behind.
Oh, my goodness! poor man! He stepped right in front of me! Well don't just stand there, get some water! Get a doctor, quick!
Reckon we better find out who he is first. He may not be worth savin'.
[Takes Roy's money out of his pocket]
I'll take care of this till he comes to."
No you don't! Shame on you picking an unconscious man's pocket.
The idea, pretending you were hurt.
I thought it was a good idea.
Well, I hope you got bumped hard enough to look where you're going.
Oh, but I'm afraid I've been bumped harder than you realize. May I, ah, have your name and address?
You may not!
But I have an internal injury I'd like to come around and talk to you about.
You have a colossal nerve!
Takes nerve in a competitive world. I'll bet I have a lot of competition. Unless you're married.
No... Yes, I am. I'm married and I have five children.
But I heard you the first time.
Well I'm not interested in what you heard, nor in standing here talking to you, and furthermore...
Your under arrest!
...your under arrest! What for?
For arguing in the street, that's against celebration rules.
This is my granddaughter, Betty Lou. This is Roy Rogers, the new cook. And his helper.
[Betty Lou holds her hand up]
How do you do Mr. Rogers?
[Roy shakes her hand and then removes his hat]
How do you do?
[Oliver comes over from the sink]
This is her boyfriend, Oliver.
Howdy.
Hi.
Grandfather, please. Oliver is NOT my boyfriend. He's merely the little boy who lives on the next ranch.
Is that so? Well just for that, you can wash your own dishes! You were right Cyclone. Women, phooey!
